alert.note: Alert for Macon; Schley; Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 6:35PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Macon, western Dooly, southwestern Houston, southeastern Schley and Sumter Counties through 715 PM EST ... At 635 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Fountainville to near Americus to near Croxton Crossroads, and moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Oglethorpe, Montezuma, Byromville, Leslie, Andersonville, Lilly, De Soto, Dooling, Desoto, Sumter, Lamar, Whitewater State Park, Croxton Crossroads, New Era, Huntington, Pennington, Drayton, Clearview, and Methvins. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
